If you run out of food tokens, you can cache cards instead.

If the wingspan of the top card is equal to or larger than your predator’s power, discard the card instead.

If you perform more than one action "at the end of your turn", you may perform those actions in any order.
Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.

Power text: Discard 1 [egg] to draw 2 [card].

Power text: Discard 1 [card] from your hand. If you do, play another bird in your [forest]. Pay its normal food and egg cost.

Power text: Look at a [card] from the deck. If <100cm, tuck it behind this bird. If not, discard it.
Note:
These birds eat other birds. Look at the wingspan of the top card of the deck and compare it to their hunting power.
If the wingspan of the top card in the deck is less than the bird’s hunting power, tuck that card to signify that your predator hunted successfully. Each tucked card is worth 1 point at the end of the game.
If the wingspan of the top card is equal to or larger than your predator’s power, discard the card instead.

rulings.text: When using this bird's power to move this bird to another habitat, the action cube does not change habitats with it.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, also lay 1 [egg] on this bird.
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

rulings.text: If this bird already has the maximum number of [egg] on it, you may still use its power to tuck a [card].

additionalRulings.text: Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.

Power text: Tuck a [card] from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 [card].
Note: These birds all allow you to tuck a card from your hand for a point, then gain some additional benefit (lay an egg, draw a card, or gain a food). You can only gain the benefit if you first tuck a card from your hand.

additionalRulings.text: Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.

Power text: If you used all 4 types of actions this round, play another bird. Pay its normal food and egg cost.
Note: If the additional bird has a “when played” power, it is triggered when the bird is played. If the extra bird has a “round end” power, it is triggered when the bird is played.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you may resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.

additionalRulings.text: You may substitute 2 [wild] for any 1 food in a bird's food cost whenever you play a bird, including outside the scope of the "play a bird" action.

Power text: All players may discard 1 [seed] from their supply to lay 1 [egg].
Note: If you discard a [seed] you may lay the [egg] on any bird not necessarily on the Zebra Dove itself.

additionalRulings.text: "Discarding" food while resolving a bird power counts as "spending".
Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.
